metadata.title: CVE-2022-3308 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in developer tools in Google Chrome priorto 106.0.5249.62 allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform a sandboxescape via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: Medium)

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3308` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '107.0.5304.87-0ubuntu11.18.04.1').
